intro: Neooreophilus tridactylus, commonly known as the three-toed forest fern, is a rare and ancient plant species found in the dense, humid undergrowth of tropical rainforests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Neooreophilus tridactylus is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
